intro: Holodiscus discolor proles ariifolius, commonly known as the white-veined holodiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in spherical inflorescences. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptic in shape and have a smooth, glossy surface. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
